ygData.subject: Rebuilding Balista
ygData.msgSnippet: After years... no, decades, she started getting some feeble sensory input. She perceived a droning sound, monotonous and continuous, yet it was fragmented as

Subject: Rebuilding Balista
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=225937926; y=1aiJZ4GtQSZfSUTOXY6grI6vab_3ymGI9kwXWIC15gqpfLyQilXa
X-Yahoo-Profile: warriorazure

After years... no, decades, she started getting some feeble sensory
input. She perceived a droning sound, monotonous and continuous, yet
it was fragmented as her audio receiver were rusty and in bad shape.
She also had some tactil perceptions... at least, enough to know that
she was not whole. Some of her parts were missing, and that
disquieting fact was more than sufficient to make her panick. She
started moving as best as she could, when a huge hand pinned her down
where she was. She realized there was talking, yet she couldn't
perceive it. Then, she felt something jab in one of her input at the
base of her skull.

She was being messengered.

"Easy now, Warrior. You are in good hands now."

"What? Where am I?"

"Olympus Complex, this world's largest military base. You're being
repaired. We found you in many pieces, but don't worry. We'll make you
better than before."

"Thanks... I guess..."

"Rest for now, Warrior. Go into stasis, because what is about to come
will be painful."

And she sank back into the nothingness of the shutdown.
